snippet: The poll found that 66 percent of voters want the next mayor to share control of the schools with an independent school board.
abstract: The poll found that 66 percent of voters want the next mayor to share control of the schools with an independent school board.
lead_paragraph: New York City voters strongly disapprove of Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg's handling of the public schools, and are much more likely to trust the teachers' union than the mayor to advocate for students, according to a Quinnipiac University poll released Wednesday morning.

headline.main: Poll Finds Strong Disapproval of Mayor's Handling of Schools
